intro: Nanocnide japonica, commonly known as Japanese nanocnide, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its delicate appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for ornamental purposes.
